byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Monica Davey from Yorkville, Ill., Dave Philipps from New York, and Carl Hulse and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: FBI investigation into former House Speaker J Dennis Hastert shows he was paying former student hundreds of thousands of dollars to keep quiet about sexual abuse by Hastert; Hastert was a high school teacher and coach in Yorkville, Ill, from 1965 to 1981, though it is not clear when abuse occurred; federal prosecutors indict Hastert for making cash withdrawals totaling $1.7 million to evade detection from banks.
lead_paragraph: Two people briefed on an F.B.I. investigation of J. Dennis Hastert, the former House speaker, said the payments were hush money to conceal misconduct during his years as a teacher.

headline.main: Hastert Case Is Said to Be Linked to Decades-Old Sexual Abuse
headline.print_headline: Hastert Payouts Said to Be Linked to Sexual Abuse

snippet: Two people briefed on an F.B.I. investigation of J. Dennis Hastert, the former House speaker, said the payments were hush money to conceal misconduct during his years as a teacher.
